page.title: 04WILDLIFE AROUND AYLESFORD
page.content: Our D block contains 3 Wildlife Conservation areas.Westfield Wood is a mixed deciduous wood on the scarp slope of the North Downs in the N.E.of the block.Cobtree Manor Park belongs to the Maidstone Borough,part of it has been set aside as a nature reserve,with a guided walk through it. The third area is a disused clay pit behind the houses in Rochester Road Aylesford.It shelters a wealth of bird and insect life.Many different types of mammals live in the D block.Lots of them come out at night such as the Badger,Rabbit,Fox,Hedgehog and Mole. Others live on the streams bank like the voles and shrews.There are several bats Serotine,Pipistrelle amongest others.Other mammals to be found are stoat,weasel,grey squirrel,hare,field mouse,house mouse,and brown rat.
